summary.p: Is enthusiastic about Stumpf's draft of a [historical-topographical] description of the Zurich area; Stumpf should continue with his work; encloses [relevant] material that Stumpf should return after use; wants to support Stumpf's project within his means; welcomes the division [of the planned work] into thirteen books; Stumpf should proceed according to his plan; Bullinger expects the part concerning Germany and other completed passages; he always studies with joy what Stumpf sends him.

div.p: You are wondering how I like what you have written about the Zurich area? So much that nothing could be better. But I do not wish to say anything in person and praise a most dear friend to his face. I pray that you continue. I have added some things, which you will find; once you have used them, please return them. For I sincerely wish to promote your undertaking, not just to help. Nor will I spare any effort or expense, as far as my modest means allow, etc. The division into 13 books seems to have more clarity, grace, and evidence.
Therefore, continue to follow the order you have established. I am expecting your section on Germany and what you have completed. I read with great pleasure what you send.
May the Lord keep you and your wife safe. Zurich, 24th November 1542.
